pr_title: [MOB-888] Add nullability annotations for better Kotlin interoperability

timeline.bodyText: name cannot be null right? If it can, then we have not handled the JSONException that might occur
timeline.author: Ayyanchira

replies.bodyText: JSONException would not occur if customActionName is null, it will just do nothing. But good point, in the two places we're calling this, in the worst case the value is an empty string, but not null.
replies.author: vbabenkoru

timeline.bodyText: Not sure but can messageID be null here?
timeline.author: Ayyanchira

replies.bodyText: Practically no, but since the code creating IterableAttributionInfo decodes this value from JSON via optString and does not explicitly check for null, I've marked this as nullable. At this point I'm just adding annotations trying to minimize code changes.
replies.author: vbabenkoru

timeline.message: Add nullability annotations for better Kotlin interoperability
Add nullability annotations for better Kotlin interoperability
